author: Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001
Teoderick Contreras, Splunk
description: Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001: The following analytic detects the execution of the "sudo" or "su" command on a Linux operating system. It leverages data from Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) agents, focusing on process names and parent process names. This activity is significant because "sudo" and "su" commands are commonly used by adversaries to elevate privileges, potentially leading to unauthorized access or control over the system. If confirmed malicious, this activity could allow attackers to execute commands with root privileges, leading to severe security breaches, data exfiltration, or further system compromise. Rule converted with Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001
false_positives: Administrator or network operator can execute this command. Please update the filter macros to remove false positives.
name: Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001: Linux Sudo OR Su Execution
note: The following analytic detects the execution of the "sudo" or "su" command on a Linux operating system. It leverages data from Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) agents, focusing on process names and parent process names. This activity is significant because "sudo" and "su" commands are commonly used by adversaries to elevate privileges, potentially leading to unauthorized access or control over the system. If confirmed malicious, this activity could allow attackers to execute commands with root privileges, leading to severe security breaches, data exfiltration, or further system compromise.
query: process where event.type == "start" and (process.name : ("sudo", "su") or process.parent.name : ("sudo", "su"))
